info.title: Resource Manager API
info.summary: Service to manage resources to run the jobs.
info.description:
Resource Manager API enables CRUD operations on resources such as queues, deployments, applications,
and app-runtime-configs.

### Features

**Queues**
- Create queues with custom storage, resource limits, and environment variables.
- Specify resource limits in two ways:
    - `maximum_allowed_worker_instances`: Maximum concurrent worker instances in the queue (`-1` means unlimited).
    - `maximum_allowed_resources`: Maximum CPU and memory resources for the queue (currently only CPU is supported).
        - If a job specifies `resources_requested`, it is used.
        - Otherwise, the application's `default_resources` (from AppRuntimeConfig) are used.
        - If neither is specified, the queue's `maximum_resources` are used.
- Manage queues to configure applications within resource limits and group applications with similar storage needs.

**Plugins**
- Register plugins defining container runtimes (e.g., Docker Engine, Kubernetes).

**Jobs**
- Submit jobs by providing application details (name, version, image, environment variables, etc.).
- Track job status and clean up resources after completion.

post.description:
Create a new queue.

:param queue: The queue to create

put.description:
Update a queue using its name.

:param queue: The queue to update

get.description:
Get all queues using filter.

:param filter_exp: OData filter to filter queues
:param offset: items to skip
:param limit: number of items to retrieve

parameters.name: filter_exp

schema.title: Filter expression
schema.description: The expression must be compatible with OData

parameters.description: The expression must be compatible with OData

get.description:
Get a queue by its id.

:param queue_id: id of the queue to retrieve

post.description:
Create a new job.

:param job: The job to create

get.description:
Get all jobs using filter.

:param filter: OData filter to filter jobs
:param offset: items to skip
:param limit: number of items to retrieve

Get a job by its id.

:param job_id: id of the job to retrieve

Get job status by its id.

:param job_id: id of the job to retrieve

post.description:
Clean job resources.

:param job_id: id of the job to clean

Register a new plugin.

:param plugin: The plugin configuration

parameters.name: filter_exp

schema.title: Filter expression
schema.description: The expression must be compatible with OData

parameters.description: The expression must be compatible with OData

post.description:
Creates a new application.

:param application: The application to create

put.description:
Updates an application.

:param application: The application to update

get.description:
Gets application by its id.

:param app_id: id of the application

get.summary: Get App Runtime Configs For Application
get.description:
Get all AppRuntimeConfigs registered for the given application id.

It retrieves the queues for the provided application from AppRuntimeConfig Model.

:param app_id: Optional field if provided returns the registered queues for given application
:param filter_exp: OData filter to filter queues
:param offset: items to skip
:param limit: number of items to retrieve

parameters.name: filter_exp

schema.title: Filter expression
schema.description: The expression must be compatible with OData

parameters.description: The expression must be compatible with OData

schema.title: Response App-Runtime-Config-Get App Runtime Configs For Application

get.description:
Get application queue for given queue id and application id.

:param queue_id: queue id
:param app_id:  application id

post.description:
Registers an application to the provided queue.

:param queue_id: The queue where the application will be registered
:param app_id: The application to register

put.description:
Update an application to the provided queue.

:param queue_id: The queue where the application will be registered
:param app_id: The application to update
